title: Foster the People's 'Sacred Hearts Club' is a Fun Ride
summary: Foster the People's new album is reminiscent of classic rock bands like Pink Floyd and Led Zeppelin. Artists often write about the things they experienced in their youth, so it makes sense that your artistic career is shaped by your formative years. When you're writing songs, you’re likely to explore what you were experiencing during that time. It’s healthy for artists to push their own boundaries, and artists who want to experiment with new sounds should consider releasing their music independently – this will allow you to fully explore your creative vision.

This is especially true for artists who revisit the music of their youth. Many artists \u2013 including Foster the People \u2013 first got their start in garage bands in their teens.
If you\u2019re an artist seeking inspiration, it can be helpful to think back to your high school years. Foster the People\u2019s album is reminiscent of classic rock bands like Pink Floyd and Led Zeppelin. In fact, \u201CHustling\u201D features a saxophone solo that sounds eerily similar to Pink Floyd\u2019s \u201CMoney\u201D. It might seem like a stretch, but artists like Pink Floyd and the Beatles have always served as inspiration for musicians. You might not be the next Zeppelin or Floyd, but you can certainly be inspired by them.`),mdx("h2",null,"It helps you reconnect with your youth."),mdx("p",null,"When artists go back to their roots, they\u2019re often reconnecting with the musical vision they had as a teenager. Artists often write about the things they experienced in their youth, so it makes sense that your artistic career is shaped by your formative years. When you\u2019re writing songs, you\u2019re likely to explore what you were experiencing during that time."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re an artist who wants to get back to your roots, start by exploring what was going on in your life during that time. Foster the People\u2019s album certainly reflects the band\u2019s youth. The LP\u2019s theme is tied to the California license plate \u201CSLOMO\u201D \u2013 a reference to the band\u2019s time spent in Los Angeles. It\u2019s possible that the band members were inspired by their experiences living in the city, which brings us back to the previous point."),mdx("h2",null,"Sometimes going back to the basics is exactly what you need."),mdx("p",null,"If you find yourself in a creative rut, consider taking a step back and simplifying your process. For example, make a list of your favorite artists in the world, and ask yourself why you\u2019re a fan. This can help you engage with your core audience."),mdx("p",null,"Foster the People's list of influences for this album include Pink Floyd and Weezer. At their core, these artists are great songwriters. The best way to get back to the basics is to focus on your craft and come up with a bunch of killer songs."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to get back to the basics but aren\u2019t sure where to start, try writing lyrics without the music. This will help you identify what you\u2019re really feeling. You can then take these emotions and use them to create music."),mdx("h2",null,"It\u2019s healthy for artists to push their own boundaries."),mdx("p",null,`When artists go back to their roots, they\u2019re often looking to push their boundaries. We\u2019re all familiar with the saying, \u201CIf you do what you\u2019ve always done, you\u2019ll get what you\u2019ve always gotten.\u201D But in this case, it might be exactly what you need.
When Foster the People released their debut album in 2011, the music was very accessible. The album was heavy on pop, alternative and dance sounds. The band\u2019s new album, \u2018Sacred Hearts Club\u2019, is much more experimental. Tracks like \u201CPay the Man\u201D are multi-layered and heavy on psychedelic sounds.`),mdx("p",null,"When artists push their own boundaries, there\u2019s a good chance listeners will respond. Artists who want to experiment with new sounds should consider releasing their music independently \u2013 this will allow you to fully explore your creative vision."),mdx("h2",null,"You\u2019ll have a whole new set of tools to work with."),mdx("p",null,`When artists go back to their roots, they often discover they now have a whole new set of tools to work with. The best way to put this into practice is to start listening to music that inspired your favourite artists, but also look at the artists who were inspired by those artists.
This is a cyclical process that can help you get inspired and create something new. Foster the People has done just that. Take the track \u201CLoyal Like Sid and Nancy\u201D and the track \u201CFireflies\u201D by Owl City. These songs are very similar to \u201CLoyal Like Sid and Nancy\u201D, and both songs were written and released before \u201CLoyal Like Sid and Nancy\u201D.`),mdx("p",null,"You might not be able to create an album as thematically and sonically consistent as \u2018Sacred Hearts Club\u2019, but you can certainly pull a few tricks from Foster the People\u2019s playbook."),mdx("h2",null,"You\u2019ll discover your core listeners respond to most."),mdx("p",null,`When artists go back to their roots, they\u2019re often looking for inspiration. But along the way, they might discover that their core listeners respond to something specific in their music. This could be anything from a particular melody to an element of your lyrics.
When Foster the People created their debut album, they knew they wanted certain songs to be singles. The band even used click tracks to make sure they hit the beats they wanted. But on their new album, they displayed a certain level of spontaneity.`),mdx("p",null,"For example, the track \u201CPay the Man\u201D begins with an improvised saxophone solo. It\u2019s possible that the band members were inspired by their youth and wanted to experiment. If this is the case, it\u2019s possible that your core listeners respond to your experimentation. And that\u2019s a good thing! It means you\u2019re staying true to yourself."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Foster the People's latest album is a fun ride through the group's youth. When artists go back to their roots, they're often looking to push their boundaries. Artists who want to experiment with new sounds should consider releasing their music independently to give them full creative freedom. When artists get back to their roots, they discover they now have a whole new set of tools to work with. When artists go back to their roots, they're often looking to push their boundaries. relatedArticles.title: "Bridge of Spies" Is a Masterful Cold War Thriller

intro.compiledSource:
var p=Object.defineProperty,m=Object.defineProperties;var u=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var d=(e,o,t)=>o in e?p(e,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[o]=t,r=(e,o)=>{for(var t in o||(o={}))s.call(o,t)&&d(e,t,o[t]);if(n)for(var t of n(o))i.call(o,t)&&d(e,t,o[t]);return e},l=(e,o)=>m(e,u(o));var h=(e,o)=>{var t={};for(var a in e)s.call(e,a)&&o.indexOf(a)<0&&(t[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var a of n(e))o.indexOf(a)<0&&i.call(e,a)&&(t[a]=e[a]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var a=t,{components:e}=a,o=h(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(r(r({},layoutProps),o),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`With the specter of mutually assured destruction looming over every global crisis and proxy conflict, the Cold War is perhaps one of the most fraught periods in history. There are no heroes in this period\u2014just two paranoid superpowers scrambling to maintain the upper hand, irrespective of cost. The inherent darkness and moral ambiguity of that period makes for fantastic fodder for any storyteller looking to immerse their audience in a stark world where there are no easy answers.
The 1980s was a peak moment in that tension\u2014from Reagan\u2019s \u201Cevil empire\u201D speech and constant saber-rattling, to the U.S.-backed Contra War against Communist rebels in Nicaragua and an escalation of tensions between NATO and the USSR all around the globe. In brief: It was not a good time to be alive if you believed in world peace. Thankfully, Hollywood had spies as intrepid as Tom Hanks ready to leap into action against those dastardly Soviet Commies whenever they needed someone captured or rescued from behind enemy lines.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Hip Hop Music with a Purpose: The Importance of Awareness in the Music Industry

intro.compiledSource:
var h=Object.defineProperty,d=Object.defineProperties;var m=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var o=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var a=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var u=(e,s,t)=>s in e?h(e,s,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[s]=t,n=(e,s)=>{for(var t in s||(s={}))a.call(s,t)&&u(e,t,s[t]);if(o)for(var t of o(s))r.call(s,t)&&u(e,t,s[t]);return e},c=(e,s)=>d(e,m(s));var p=(e,s)=>{var t={};for(var i in e)a.call(e,i)&&s.indexOf(i)<0&&(t[i]=e[i]);if(e!=null&&o)for(var i of o(e))s.indexOf(i)<0&&r.call(e,i)&&(t[i]=e[i]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var i=t,{components:e}=i,s=p(i,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,c(n(n({},layoutProps),s),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`The music industry is vast, expansive, and unending. The number of subgenres and variations within the larger genres is innumerable. It\u2019s also an industry that has recently come under fire for its lack of diversity and representation in regards to gender, sexuality, religion, race, and so much more. As a result of these issues becoming more apparent and publicized, artists have been producing music with a purpose; focusing on important topics and causes through their music.
If you spend any time listening to rap or hip-hop music, you\u2019ve probably noticed how many songs are about money, sex, drugs, partying\u2014basically all the things you can do when you\u2019re rich and famous. But there are some rappers who are using their fame to make a difference in the world by speaking out about problems that need to be addressed: social injustice, poverty, drug abuse, child exploitation and other serious issues. These artists are making a conscious effort to use their music to make a positive impact on society rather than just focusing on things like materialism or promiscuity.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

However, that doesn\u2019t mean there hasn\u2019t been some brilliant albums released so far this year. While last year had some incredible albums (like Kendrick Lamar\u2019s \u201CDamn,\u201D Lorde\u2019s \u201CMelodrama,\u201D and Noel Gallagher\u2019s High Flying Birds' "Who Built the Moon?"), this year hasn\u2019t quite matched up to those standards. relatedArticles.title: The History of Hip Hop Music: The Influential Years

intro.compiledSource:
var u=Object.defineProperty,m=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(e,o,t)=>o in e?u(e,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[o]=t,s=(e,o)=>{for(var t in o||(o={}))r.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);if(a)for(var t of a(o))i.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);return e},p=(e,o)=>m(e,c(o));var l=(e,o)=>{var t={};for(var n in e)r.call(e,n)&&o.indexOf(n)<0&&(t[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var n of a(e))o.indexOf(n)<0&&i.call(e,n)&&(t[n]=e[n]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var n=t,{components:e}=n,o=l(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,p(s(s({},layoutProps),o),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Hip hop music is a universal language. It has proven to be a way for people from different cultures and backgrounds to come together and express themselves. From its humble beginnings in New York City, hip hop has grown into a worldwide sensation, with local scenes spawning in cities across the globe. This article explores the history of hip-hop music, from its roots as an underground movement in the early 1980s to its predominance as one of the most popular genres today.
Fans of rap music are undoubtedly aware that this style of music has origins in New York City during the 1970s and 1980s, but there is much more to know about how exactly it came about and how it evolved over time. From breakdancing to rapping, we\u2019ll explore all of the elements that blended together to form what we now call \u201Chip-hop\u201D today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' Is a Solid Effort

intro.compiledSource:
var p=Object.defineProperty,c=Object.defineProperties;var d=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var a=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(t,e,o)=>e in t?p(t,e,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):t[e]=o,i=(t,e)=>{for(var o in e||(e={}))a.call(e,o)&&h(t,o,e[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(e))r.call(e,o)&&h(t,o,e[o]);return t},l=(t,e)=>c(t,d(e));var u=(t,e)=>{var o={};for(var s in t)a.call(t,s)&&e.indexOf(s)<0&&(o[s]=t[s]);if(t!=null&&n)for(var s of n(t))e.indexOf(s)<0&&r.call(t,s)&&(o[s]=t[s]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var s=o,{components:t}=s,e=u(s,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(i(i({},layoutProps),e),{components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Charlie Puth has been on a roll lately, with three top 40 hits in the last two years. He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

More than ever before, people are listening to and talking about rappers. But with so much of the genre becoming commodified and predictable, it can be difficult for new artists to stand out among the noise. Fortunately, just because most popular rap fails to break any molds doesn\u2019t mean that the genre is completely devoid of creative talent. In fact, there are a number of rappers who have been working hard to maintain their integrity while still appealing to a larger audience. If you\u2019re ready to put on your dancing shoes and get out on the floor with one of these 10 amazing rappers who will make you want to dance:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
